text: Damn........just went by here and the place burned down:( Been going here for over 30 years, love there blt. Guess they will be opening soon.....can't wait. Never realize how much you miss a place until its gone.

This place had a fire on Christmas Eve but very excited for the Re-opening.  Great place for a quick bite or to seat and enjoy breakfast, lunch and/or dinner.  Don't forget to follow them on Facebook, they have a new page!!! m.facebook.com/dinergril…
No worries all - it should be reopening in March. Only have to wait two more months for delicious patty melts. chicagotribune.com/dinin…

Upset to hear about the fire. I've had  many quick lunches at this place, and it's great for what it is. No gourmet food, no fancy coffee, nothing to surprise anyone, but the skillets are good, the fries are good, the chili is good, and the price is always right. Not too many seats, but the service is quick. As tiny local diners go, this is one of the best I've seen.

Saddened by the tragedy that befell this joint on Christmas Eve, of all nights. Figured I'd write a glowing review in hopes that they are able to get back on their feet and some day reopen!  Places like this are quintessentially American - the classic, 24-hour greasy spoon. Perfect for the shift worker who's starving after punching the clock at the factory all night to my drunk ass at 3 a.m.  Friendly staff, efficient line cooks, and dandy grub. In the event they do hopefully reopen, they have amazing milk shakes. Order the slinger. You won't regret it, but may want to split with a special friend.
So sad to hear about this place being on fire over the xmas weekend.  This place is a city icon and needs to be rebuilt to it's old school glory.  Hope this happens.

Omg what can I say about this place. It's a must go to place.  Please don't Let the look of this place fool you into not eating here. It's been here for years and years. When you walk in it's about the size of a train maybe, long and small.  That's what makes this place awesome.  The cooks cook your food in front of you and it's pretty neat to watch them cook. The prices are very good, and they fill your plate with food. The food is amazing but if you are here to eat healthy , this place is not your place.  They are open 24 hours. The staff / cooks there are friendly.

True fact: ate here twice in a two day period. Your classic short order grill straight from the 1950s. Counter seating only. Eggs, French toast, pancakes, burgers, omelettes etc. we had a party of 8 both times -- service was fast and efficient. And the food was excellent. Nothing fancy , no salads, nothing healthy. But delicious. Btw the name is actually the Dinner Grill.
Best diner ever! I usually go with the corned beef hash because they cook breakfast like absolute pros.

Great drunken stop for food!  Kenny, the nightly and weekend chef, was awesome!  Food is what you would expect for the type of place but it surprised me !  Got the French toast and eggs.  Definitely appeased my drunk self

Cheap and tastes great. They've got all the basics and the cooks are consummate professionals. I go for the hobo skillet most times but they've got solid lunch offerings as well. Nothing fancy, but you're getting the most bang for your buck here. Highly recommended.

Came in around midnight for a bite to eat. I got the pancake and sausage and added an egg. The restaurant is pretty small, and only space to sit at the bar but they cook right in front of you which is cool. He didn't ask me how i wanted my egg cooked and i forgot to say it so I had to ask him to cook it more after he plated it. He wasn't too pleased about that.  The atmosphere is very diner -like with a juke box. Very good food, especially late night.

This was a hidden gem. we arrived in Chicago on a late night and were pretty hungry from the drive. on the way to where we were staying we drove past this place and were intrigued. we got settled in and drove back. Best decision ever! not only is the service just Excellent (Ken might be one of the nicest guys) but the food was just want you want and crave at 2:30am! it gives you that old school theme like you are in a scene from back to the future. it was so good and pleasant that a few months later we put it on the list to have to come back and we did and it was just as terrific

You just left the Ten Cat Tavern, and worse, the Tamale man is no where to be found. But lo and behold, DINER GRILL with it's bright white sign and bold lettering calls you into it's home. You sit at the counter and see the variety of breakfast food, burgers, and sandwiches. I got the slinger, it was bad but also so very good! It had everything my friend and I needed: Burgers, Chili, hash browns, and eggs. Now at the end I did manage to get this feeling, regret. It's a little much to be honest and my morning didn't enjoy as much as I did.

Fernando was great!  Good hearted dude.  This place will give you a personal and homey vibe with the other patrons and the cook.  I feel like this old 50's style diner delivers that love, sense of family, and friendship feel to it.  The food was greasy, cheap, and good!  I ordered the bacon cheese burger with fries and cheese on the side to dip. The burger was juicy and had this firework smokey taste to it.  It was so good!  Just be prepared for violent farts noon after!
We ordered bacon&eggs and shared a short stack. all eggs were exact to order. Bacon crisp or easy, perfect. And the hash browns were some of the best I've had.  Price was good.

Day 303: Diner Grill: Going to the Diner Grill was kind of a spur of the moment thing. I had seen it on the  extracrispy.com  list of America's Best Diner's, and so we went to check it out. It's set in an old railroad car with the grill in front of you and a sassy guy named Kenny working at it. We both got the famed Slinger, a concoction of hash browns, grilled onions, two grilled burger patties with cheese and two eggs over easy topped with chili, mostly because it's hard to turn down any dish that comes with a certificate for completing it and, allegedly, the chili recipe had been bought off a hooker for $100 in 1946, which is a hell of a pedigree. It had quite a lot going for it, so I'm a little disappointed that the food was only decent. The burgers and eggs were terrific, but the chili was a little bland and the hash browns unsalted and mushy. There was a lot of food for the price, and I can see why the place is popular for drunk/hungover eats, but I'm iffy on if it's really the best diner in Illinois. The quest for 24hr perfection continues...

It is a simple diner with a simple menu, but it is GOOD! First time visit for a late breakfast. I have to echo another review that simple eggs, ham, hash-browns, and toast, prepared skillfully and with care and served with a smile tops many if not most other restaurants I have tried in this area for breakfast. They also take pride in the facility and keep it clean and presentable.  It is on the way to work, open 24/7, and I shall be back! Gracias amigos!!

Stopped in here this morning to grab some breakfast. There was no one in the place when I got there around 9am, but the sign said OPEN and the Yelp reviews were good so I said why not! It did not disappoint! I just got a typical eggs, bacon and toast breakfast, however when it's made right there is no better breakfast choice!! The bacon was perfectly crisp, the eggs were exactly how I ordered and the toast popped out as my meal was served. It was delicious!!! And that bacon!! I still can't get over how good it was!! The service was great. I guess when there is only one customer you'll get that, however the guy was super nice and attentive and I'm sure he's like that regardless of the number of customers! Definitely recommended if you're in the area!

Everything I could want in a 24 hour greasy spoon diner. Cheap good food, soda fountain a walk down he block and a breakfast menu. Now coming from a place of abundant waffle houses and finding none in Chicago near me basically means this an oasis in the desert that my life right nah'.  My only complaint is I live literally a half block from this place and nothing can save me from eating here too much. I had the patty melt and fries with a coke classic. Nothing fancy but it delivers on what it needs to.

Diner Grill is the type of greasy establishment I love to frequent and would do so more often if diabetes didn't run in my family gene pool.  10 bar stools, yellow lights, and sticky counter tops - I love every bit of it.  I'm truly obsessed with the patty melt. One of my buddies used to live around the corner back in college and he put me on game.
Classic, no-fuss late night spot with the expected comfort diner foods. Great chili, warm coffee, and hard working owner who seems to be there every hour of the day.

Ate here at 3 am after trying to find a place to grab some food. Very happy we did. Legit small diner with only about 14 seats right in the action. Had a cheeseburger and Fries and it hit the spot. Few others had breakfast and it was also very good. Really cool experience because of the close proximity to the flat top and the interactions with the guys working. Will be back for sure to try the other items

Dinner grill is Chicago's biggest secret! It's a small place but looks can be deceiving. If you're coming on the weekend make sure to get a slinger. Their burgers are amazing and the place is family owned and you're treated like family when you walk in.

For late-night eats this is the spot. Stop In and ask for the slinger. It's been feeding Chicago since 1936.. It's not fancy in fact anything but however u need to go at least once. It's like living history.

Exactly what you'd expect - a diner! Simple menu, greasy grill and a bunch of stools at a counter. It doesn't pretend to be anything that it's not. Come here for reasonably priced, good old fashioned diner grub. The cook makes the bacon VERY crispy, so you're going to want to warn them if you prefer your bacon on the chewy side. I love crispy, so it was perfect for me. I feel a bit like I'm missing out since I haven't come in the middle of the night. #lifegoals

How did this nice girl find herself in this place on a recent Saturday night (or was it a Sunday morning?)  Who knows?  I'm not quite sure . . .but that's the beauty of the Diner Grill.  On any given night you can find a wide range of interesting people sitting at these green counter stools and ordering the most interesting of diner foods. On my most recent visit, I was the only woman in the place.  Is that what prompted two of the young men to get up, move down and give me their seat?  Who knows?  But I promptly sat, and with my seat mate's coaching began to read the menu on the wall.  Two more women walked in and grabbed vacated seats too so chivalry is not dead at 3am! Behind the counter are two guys who know how to work a short order grill.  Orders are being shouted out, cooked, presented and paid for.  It was almost like a dance watching it all come together.  And when one of the guys told me I had to have a "Slinger", well you know the saying "when in Rome . . . . . . ." So happy and sated, I left The Diner.  But not without a backward glance to see who had taken my vacated stool and to listen to the process start all over again!   "Whadya have?" says the one cook. "I'll have the Slinger".  And so it begins again.

It tastes about the same as it looks like on the outside.   A fun experience with good greasy food.  It is what it is.  Don't go here if you're worried about the ingredients.  Go here if you're hungry and want to eat a burger on a counter.
Cheap and cheerful.  One of a dying breed of the classic "diner experience"....

As good as a diner can get! The person behind the counter was the host, the server, the cook and the cashier! Love it! opened in 1937 an old rail car. Been driving by this place for 23 years, finally got the chance to have breakfast with my twin brother and catch up on life. 2 eggs over easy, ham off the bone, hashbrowns, coffee and rye toast buttered, my standby breakfast. Excellent one of the best I've ever had.

When someone whines on Yelp "The patrons were belligerent and told us to go write a Yelp review," I know I've found the right place.  Any diner that shows a picture of a guy holding his stomach and sitting on the toilet *in the ad for The Slinger* is serving up just what you want after a drunken bike ride in the middle of the night.  This is a rare true diner in that it is built out of rail cars.  You want ass-kissing service and a lemon-rind dribbled hand-fed duck breast wheatgrass quinoa fiddlehead amuse-bouche in a port wine reduction?  Your kind isn't welcome here.
Nice atmosphere. The food is great for the price, you get a lot of it. I've been here a couple times at like 2 am.  Always friendly too =]

My boyfriend and I go in here every so often with friends and are more than respectful to its staff, but for some reason can't get the same respect back. For the 3 of us it came out to $65for below average quality overly greasy food. When we ordered fries I got 11 French fries (I counted) But really the food wasn't the problem as much as the customer service. While we were still eating, he shoved the bill in front of us and then when my boyfriend asked for a refill he said "yeah am I going to get my money?" Never have we come here and not paid for our meal, not to mention the generous tip we always leave him. We are the least rowdy of the group and were treated very poorly. He rushed us out insisting we pay him right that second, took his cup and placed it on the table behind the counter and did not give it back until we paid. Overall, horrible service, overpriced food. And make sure you check your receipt!! They like to "accidentally" charge you for things when they think you're drunk.

Still haven't tried the slinger... Hopefully I will soon. But so far all their breakfast foods have hit the spot. I now have cravings for their breakfast sandwich with bacon and cheese every morning. Thank god they're open 24/7!

Food was subpar and service was slow. They overcharged us 13 dollars on our 70 dollar check. When we asked about  the discrepancy they were rude and ignored us. Additionally the patrons were belligerent and told us to write a yelp review.  Would not recommend to others and will not revisit.

The "Diner Grill"...what a perfect name. Two words together that we happily accept as normal English. It's the equivalent of me saying, this review is "deceptively honest"! The food is really not that good and other than the atmosphere, a far cry from quintessential diner grub. This is drunk food best served when inebriated. I would categorize this place as a 3 A.M.  "Urban Legend"  I love the fact that people read too much into this place. It's overdone & overblown for an obvious reason. Their is a niche for late night grease trap operations. The atmosphere is enticing, the camaraderie is what you make of it as long as you realize you're here for the show, or part of it. The food is really not that good, and I am deceptively honest!

Perfect place to go on a Sunday with your lady friend, with friends, or even by your lonesome.. Especially if your visiting.. Great food! Great prices! Great service! Just stop thinking about it and just go here.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. IT IS PURE. IT IS BARE BONES. IT IS SIMPLE. NOTHIN BUT LOVE. it's super cheap, kinda greasy n' always easy food! burgers, breakfast, coffee in a styrofoam cup and plastic fork type of place. the chefs are hilarious, it's good (drunk) food, there's always nice/funny company and it is what it is. :)
Good classic diner and great late night food. A little bit overpriced. Just make sure you don't get shortchanged.
This is one of the best diners I've ever been to. Fast, simple, and ever so delicious. So cheap and all done right in front of you. Great for breakfast or lunch.

This place is the quintessential urban diner. Fast, greasy, delicious food prepared right on front of you. Cheap prices. Open all night. And the best part? The slinger- a St. Louis classic that combines hamburgers with eggs and chili and hash browns in a spectacular and all-American way. Perfect.

I once thought it hard to screw up Breakfast but this morning the Diner did just that. The coffee was watered down along with the powder milk used for creamer, seriously, four stars for powdered milk???!! Be serious, I have no desire to give them one star.  The biscuits and gravy was canned crap, the ham was thin and grisly and you have to get a skillet to get hash browns!   $31.00 dollars for three people and very disappointed. Wished we went to the Piggery across the street!!

Nothing special, but diner food that hits the spot. It's also open 24 hours which is a plus! They serve breakfast food all day and also have sandwiches/burgers as well. Very quick to get your order out.

Went here on a Saturday morning for breakfast, they weren't busy but dishes were being cleaned by the same rag and hand washing so sanitary was worried. But the food looks and is a basic breakfast & sandwiches. The biscuit & gravy was too salty but my friend had the slinger which looked good.

One of the last, original diners in Chicago for good home cooking. The conversation and vary from politics to cubs, to cars and girls. This is truly one of the last and finest places in Chicago for a good conversation with total strangers...and an even better meal.
This place is awesome! Old school sit a the counter grill. I order double cheeseburger grilled onions with hash browns. Better than fries. You will not be disappointed.

At 1something this place was mostly/relatively empty. Come before 2am/where almost all other late night stuff closes and get a prime spot when the show starts. Inebriated people are pretty entertaining to watch, but the best part is the lone short order cook serving the whole now-packed diner (which is just like maybe 10-15 bar seats). Such coordinated swift actions. It's so fast paced he probably has to literally plan out every action in your head and execute them without missing a beat. Or he looks like he's done it for so long it's all just second nature. Anyway, the food is what you'd expect. Hashbrowns, mediocre quality burger patties, fake American cheese, boring white bread buns. But late night greasy food... what more do you expect? It's cooked as well as it can be and in front of you in minutes.  The Slinger is NOT worth it though. It's just hashbrowns + 2 cheeseburger patties + egg + really mediocre chili. I don't even think the combination works, and it's especially unimpressive if you ask for the chili on the side.  I'd definitely come here again, but only under pretty unique circumstances. Or maybe order a burger and watch the show. Nothing I'd crave or go out of my way for, unfortunately. Might explore other 24-hr diner options before returning...

I gotta tell you, no one was more surprised than I was at what an incredible meal I had here. The best food I've ever had from (what is essentially) a trailer, that's for sure. Fancy dining, this is not. A counter for ten and a menu that covers the basics; burgers, eggs, bacon, grilled cheese. Straight up diner food, and they do it right! I had a double cheeseburger with bacon and added a fried egg to it, and it was incredible. The bacon was crisped up right and the burger was cooked perfectly. The fries were nothing short of incredible. They dropped them right when I ordered, so they came out fresh, hot, and crisp. My friend got the Haystack and I have never regretted not ordering something more in my life. It was delicious! Hash browns, gravy, eggs, sausage, and biscuits. Heaven in my mouth!  We went on a Saturday around 12:30 and there were about five other people there, but I hear it is packed to the gills if you go in the middle of the night on the weekends. Cash only and they have an ATM in the doorway. Seriously, I am so in love with this place and I cannot wait until my next trip back!

I have been here many many times and it never disappoints. This is a staple of Chicago. I love how traditional  and modern the set up is with close to 20 bar stools, but an updated jukebox and a small flat screen TV. The food here is standard, but very good. You're classic eggs and bacon, cheeseburger and fries. The late night atmosphere is what keeps this alive. The cooks have the traditional diner hats on and are always friendly. I will throw this out there. A lot of reviews mention the famous slinger, but honestly it's not that good. There is a diner at the university of Illinois-Urbana Champagne that serves a similar dish called "the stack", which is essentially the same dish, but with more flavor. There I said it. Come here for the company and the appreciation of the traditional diner.

I don't think I could imagine a place that better represents a no-frills, 24-hour, diner. Stopped into the diner grill around lunch time with my boyfriend and was so pleasantly surprised. The food was great, the atmosphere was classic diner, and the prices were just right. I had the Gypsy Skillet which was very tasty and a big portion. My boyfriend got a double bacon cheeseburger and fries which were fresh and juicy.  It's a small spot with about 10 seats, but they do take-out. And it's cash only but there is an ATM on site.

Traditional fast diner.  They are open really early and really late and make the best hang over and late night grub.  I love their skillets and the fact that I can see them make the food right in front of me.

This place is super fun. I went after a date to Phantom and Blackbird; we are equally gluttonius, and proud of it. He dragged me there way too late for my liking, and it was packed like always. I got behind the counter and whipped up some breakfast, and had a blast. The staff are fun and interactive, and the food is legit. Its kinda off the beaten path, but worth a visit.
I spend hours on music and when I look up and it's 5 am and I know there's a place open with an awesome burger that's what life is all about. This place is the shit. Simple. Nice. Delicious

I usually come to Diner Grill late night since it's the only place open at the time that has decent food. Yesterday I went and I noticed something that I haven't noticed the other few times that I have been here. The cook never washes his hands. Ever. He touched the raw meat, patted down the hash browns, cleaned up dirty plates, gave change to one of the customers, and not ONCE did he wash his hands the whole HOUR I was there. Decent food just doesn't justify the fact that he is violating all health guidelines. It was mortifying to watch and I'm disgusted.

Five stars for a non-descript building made of cinder blocks with nothing to speak of in the immediate vicinity?   Yes, Dear God, Yes. I was taken to Diner Grill for the first time about two years ago by a friend who lived in the area.  She cautioned me that I would only like if I loved greasy diner food after a few cocktails, but who doesn't like that, so I was in.  Ever since that night, every time I need a food fix after a night out, this is my spot.   The food is spot on - great cheeseburgers, breakfast, etc.  Limited menu, but it really hits the spot.  The staff is great, and there is usually a pretty good group of customers too, with everyone being pretty chatty and friendly (it draws a pretty cult crowd).  Great jukebox selection too. It's small, so if you are going around 1 or 2, you may have to wait.  Also, cash only, but there is an ATM onsite.
Everything you want in late-night or rough morning-after food. I honestly don't know what voodoo they use to make frozen patties into such delicious burgers, but I'm not complaining.

I love this place. Every time I'm there I get a double cheeseburger with onions and fries. The patties are thin and frozen, but somehow it ends up being a delicious burger. Great place to get a quick cheap meal, as long as there's an open seat (there usually is).

Been there....completed the infamous slinger....it was BOMB. In all honesty this place is great! Staff is very friendly, food is awesome, great place to go afterhours or even at 7am after a long night out. Whether it's breakfast or dinner, everything is great!

The perfect diner experience. Atmosphere was great, food was generous, service was excellent. Our host/cook was friendly, catering, and down to earth. Open 24/7. Great after-bar food. We'll definitely be going back.

My absolute favorite and go-to late night diner in Chicago. The same awesome chef works every night, making you made-to-order delicious greasy diner fare from a classic counter. Everything is cheap and delicious.  It's cash-only, but they've got an ATM. You never know who you'll be sitting next to in this joint, as it's a very colorful place.

I can't believe I waited so long to try this place, and it was one block away! Everything you hope for and dream of when you imagine a neighborhood diner. Not a lot of seats, not a 5 page menu. They make breakfast and non-breakfast options. I had a burger, the grilled cheese looked good too. My only complaint is that they serve all drinks in Styrofoam cups, and that wreaks havoc on our environment. The food is good though! Diner fries.

Don't think I've ever ate here other than after The Long Room at nighttime for whatever odd reason(I'd guess this place would still be fine even when I wasn't drinking?), but this place is always enjoyable. People watching is fun, and I've always enjoyed the same late night cook/cashier they have had for years who works during late evening/early overnight hours. Hash browns here are actually the closest I've found to Waffle House style ones in Chicago, except that they don't offer the options to add things to them like you can at an actual WaHo('scattered, topped, chunked, etc.). Google Waffle House hash brown lingo, if you wonder what some of those terms mean btw. Finally decided to try the Slinger on my most recent recent, and wow was it great. If you ever miss the Tamale Guy while at Long Room or other nearby bars(I unfortunately have sometimes narrowly missed him), I'd say this is your best bet for eating afterwards. Cheaper and tastier than Golden Nugget IMO, even if the menu isn't as long. And like others have said, I've always enjoyed the people watching here, and the conversations you overhear.
The corn beef hash is really good and love the sit at the counter diner vibe.
Best chilli I've had in Chicago. On a cold day the chilli helps you thru the day. Great breakfast. And burgers.  but if you really hungry you got to get the slinger. You will fall in love.

Get the double dick burger and penis pancake....seriously. Awesome food at 4 am and the stuff mentioned above is off the menu. The dick burger is a burger with hash browns and eggs. Pancake is jut a huge pancake...nothing fancy just good greasy food.

It is a 100% diner and I am a fan. Nothing fancy, frilly, or over the top... well maybe the Slinger is but everything else is straight up Diner food and could not be better.  Had a Hobo Skillet and a cup of coffee, delicious.  I can see this as a good place to go when having the bite before bed after a night of drinking or the place to go in the morning after.
Best place to be after a night at the bars. Food is greasy and awesome. People watching is equally amazing.
This is an inside Chicago landmark. The building was built with two vintage "EL" cars slapped together. The best greasy food diner in Chicago.

After a night of drinking, breakfast sounded awesome at 4am at Diner Grill. Like a moth to a flame, my body gravitated to the Open 24 Hour sign.  Think greasy old school diner food where everything is cooked on the grill. It would be the perfect truck stop but instead, it's the perfect hangover joint. We ordered the Slinger - hashbrowns topped with two beef batties, two slices of cheese, two eggs, and chili. It was the perfect hangover meal but it was the most expensive item on the menu for $10.50. Next time, I'll do the single patty version on a bun. I guess they call it the Slinger since it slings its way out after digestion.  It's cash only but most of the items on the menu are between $3-7.

This place is incredible. I came here with three friends for hangover brunch, and it was PHENOMENAL. First of all, they had tasty coffee. I was very pleasantly surprised. Also, the guys (2) behind the counter were super friendly and know how to use a griddle like nobody's business. The counter seats probably about 12 people, so you might have to wait a few minutes, but it's a legitimate hole-in-the-wall diner that feels like you stepped back in time about 40 years. Absolutely loved my corned beef hash with eggs over easy. The hash was crispy and the eggs were perfect.  This is a big win in my book.

I am from out of town but I visit occasionally. I came on a weeknight around 1:30 am after my flight got in. My boyfriend lives nearby and he said he's always wanted to try this place. So we went.  It's not much in terms of decor. Very simple open kitchen (more like a grill and some shelving). Some stools at a bar. A small TV. It was empty when we got there but the seats quickly filled up.  You definitely wouldn't go here for a 3-course meal. But we enjoyed this place a lot. My boyfriend got a double cheeseburger, I got the patty melt, and we shared fries. (We didn't see this on the menu until later but you have to ask for lettuce and tomato and it's an extra charge. It wasn't a big deal for us but just FYI.) We were very impressed with the ability of the cook/server to memorize all those menu items and cooking times and exactly when to throw in what. Of course, I'm sure with years of experience, you can be that skilled in anything. But watching the guy cook up our food right in front of us.. It was nice to see the process and to know that he knew what he was doing.  I'm definitely going back the next time I'm in town. The omelettes looked delicious. Hoping to try the Garbage Omelette next time. (:

Great diner!  They keep the steak sauce behind the counter. Don't forget ask for it with your hash browns. Garbage omelette rocks for breakfast.  Corned beef hash or slinger for late nite. Don't ask, just eat!
Pretty cool late night spot whose employees get as rambunctious as the spirited customers at times.

This place executes on what it is - a small diner with exposed-kitchen. If you don't want drunks, don't go to a diner at 2AM after a Friday/Saturday night. If you don't want any of the other myriad annoyances of a diner, avoid it. If you want a damn good chocolate shake and grilled cheese (a fellow patron ordered a grilled cheese w/a hamburger patty and bacon - wow....) when you have the hankerin for one, it does it just right. Burgers and slingers, etc., are all good and just what you'd hope for from a diner.

I need to give a bit of background on this, because this restaurant almost made me not want to move into the neighborhood. How wrong I was! My uncle took me here when I was a youngin', oh so many years ago. The food was beyond greasy. A stool was missing. Being the obstinate child that I was, I asked. His response? This is Yelp, so I'll keep it PC. That said, this Irving Park location gave me the willies a bit until, yes, I ventured there as an adult. It's amazing how a visit to a notable grill like this many years later (15) can change your opinion. This is possibly the greatest diner I've been to so far (as young as I am in my adult years). This place doesn't have ambiance, it is ambiance. The hamburger? Greasy as ever? Good when sober? Yes. Good after imbibing the libations? I cannot say from experience (although I wonder if the Long Room crowd ventures across the street after it closes).

The word "amazing" is used way too often!  Expand your vocabulary people!  Nothing about Diner Grill is amazing and it doesn't strive to be amazing.  It is good, cheap and fast.  No one should go here expecting "the best  _________ ever!"  If you do, you are an idiot.   I don't get the Slinger like most people because I don't like my food looking like it....ya know, poop.  I also don't like eating stuff that is basically the same mushy texture in every layer of every bite.  Some people love the Slinger and more power to them.  I just can't understand how some people eat more than one Slinger in a sitting.  I usually get a burger and an egg sandwich with easy mayo and cheese.  The grill cooks have always been cool and easy going and they make your food fast.  I would avoid anything with sausage because I don't think it tastes very good.  Heed the advice of other reviewers, avoid late night Fri/Sat.  The drunk idiots flock to this place after the bars close and they are just THE worst.  I'm all for a good time with your buddies but it's a little much.

Let me preface this by saying that I normally dislike unreasonable haters for any business on Yelp.  This is my first review, which goes to show that I'm extremely taken by my experience at this establishment. There isn't much to argue about the food- it's good. That being said, I am more than disgusted with the way that my s/o and I were treated last night. I don't go into any restaurant, more or less a diner, expecting star treatment. But as the only "minority" (non-Caucasian) customers, we were definitely receiving the lower end of the stick. The same quality of service was not shown to us as others, and there were definitely much less-sober, belligerent diners eating around us. We had to request things that other people would just receive, were ignored when we asked questions (can I have some water, please?) and were deliberately charged the wrong amount when we asked for the check.  I felt completely disrespected by both workers at this place and am never going to go back. There are too many other good places to eat where this sort of treatment is not seen.
I love a greasy spoon and this place doesn't disappoint. Breakfast, dinner, late night ... it's all good! Plus, friendly service and really affordable prices.

This place rules.  Great vibe with diner food actually done properly. I like the double bacon cheeseburger with grilled onions and a fried egg on it, along with some hash browns.  The patties are frozen but still juicy, and the hash browns are amazing. Don't get the fries.  They're frozen and completely forgettable.  The hash browns are crispy and delicious. The bacon and egg sandwich on toast is great too; they fry the eggs over the bacon, which keeps the whole thing together when you eat it. If I lived anywhere nearby, I'd go 3x a week.  So many diners manage to mess up such seemingly simple food that this place really is a diamond in the rough.

I can always count on this neighborhood diner for a great end to a drunken evening! The guys who run the place are entertaining, and the crowd is usually friendly. Try a grilled cheese....great greasy goodness that will surely cure your hangover!  For added fun, ask the guys about the famed "penis pancake" and enjoy some laughs as they will surely create one for you to top off your meal. The best!

I'm mad at myself for giving this place less than five stars. But then again, I wrote my initial review in 2007. And in 2007 I was young and stupid. I have since seen the error of my ways: The Dinner/Diner Grill is a five-star establishment. Where else are you rewarded with a certificate printed on a 1995 dot matrix printer for consuming upwards of 1500 calories at once? Where else will you get a pancake in the shape of a dick if you tell the cooks that it's your birthday? Where else will the cook perform a fake marriage ceremony because you and your friend are drunk and decide that your shared love of the Diner/Dinner Grill is enough to bond you two for life? Where else does the fucking name of the place change depending on which side of the sign you look at? (One side says "Diner Grill" - the other says "Dinner Grill.") Nowhere. There is only Zuul/the Diner/Dinner Grill.
No frills diner. Open 24 hours. Good Food. Great Prices. Pork Chop with cheese and scrambled eggs and hash browns please. Cures my hangovers everytime!

This place is pure awesomeness.  Whether you're drunk or sober, usually drunk, this place has amazing food. Sure everyone has had their famous "Slinger" but I can truly say I devoured the entire thing including the two pieces of toast given with it. Was I drunk? You could say that or you could say this thing is just DELICIOUS!

I just moved to the neighborhood and this was the first place I insisted on going to. Fantastic. Just wonderful. Me and my bf both got the gyros. So. Much. Meat. The fries are super crispy. We are already planning our next visit. This place is your basic, old school diner. No thrills, just great diner basics. Well done Diner Grill.

This place is like a throwback to my college days. Classic diner food, open 24 hours, and located right across the street from a bar (the Long Room)! I came late on Thursday and loved the camaraderie amongst (happy/young/buzzed/drunk) patrons here. It wasn't rowdy, just fun. My burger was $2.40. This is a diner burger with a thin patty. It sort of reminded me of a glorified McD's burger which I don't have too much pride to admit there are certain moments when I can REALLY appreciate a burger like this. I like to believe most people have a special place deep within their soul that recognizes food like this has it's own time and place to be savored.  The man behind the counter seems happy to be working and accommodated requests at ease and with a smile (including the grown man who requested a tall glass of cold milk to go with his pancakes. Cute.)

This place is good. There are two men behind a counter that throw things on the grill as you call it out.  The prices are low and the end product is always made to order, greasy and delicious. The tiny place boast an impressive 13 seats(give or take), so people will ask you to move down, sit right next to you or just plan eat over your shoulder. Either way it is an enjoyable, filling experience from start to end.

came here one morning with a friend for brunch to try out the slinger... there is free parking in the front so that was nice.. once we walked in, we was surprised on how small the place was lol we didn't mind it but we was just surprised.. we both ordered the slinger and we watched him make it since the kitchen is right over the counter table where everybody eats at..i noticed that the dude didn't wear any gloves or wash his hands after touching money and then start putting food on the grill with his hands.. nastyyy!  but we still ate it anyways haha.... the slinger consist of hashbrowns,2 cheese burger patties, 2 eggs, and chili on top... it was soooo tasteless! i had to use a lot of ketchup because it was that bland... i don't think i will come back here again...

I imagine Diner Grill is more compelling if you've been drinking. I've only visited in the early evening, when it is quietly devoid of sloppy drunks and peopled instead by an after-work blue collar crowd. At any rate, for a fair price you get a no-frill flattop grill experience that is "good enough" but also nothing to rave about.

Seriously amazing...the cook's (Kenny and Fernando) are fast at taking orders, cooking and are very funny!  I've gotta order a "Slinger" every time I'm in!  The best after party spot in Lakeview! =)  There's also a juke box if you'd like to keep the party going!  Definitely go in and check it out!

This place is exactly what it says it is "Diner Grill". The good 'ol flat top grill diner. If anyone knows anything about flat top grill diners, they will know these places are very receptive to the regulars/locals and the blue collar crowd. If you're not privy to some grease, you know to put some meat on those bones, then you are not setting realistic expectations when entering this place. Don't expect being coddled here, this isn't a Denny's. If you're used to those off the beaten path diners that are ubiquitous with road trips and most southern diners, then welcome home! The best way to grade a diner (or any chef for that matter) like this is to ask them to make eggs. Have them make sunny side up, over easy, over medium, and over hard. You can do this at one sitting or multiple trips. In my experience, my eggs in each instance have come out perfectly, so here's to a perfect score.

Fernando is the absolute man. I've been going to the Diner Grill for late night snacks since I was 13. The slinger is a classic, but if your looking for an incredible drunk night cap, the Dick Burger is where it is at.

Well it was a cold night about 11.59. I was sitting in a corner in my bedroom with tears in my eyes and a glass of juicy juice  grape flavor YUMMMM . I Had a really bad case of gas not sure if it was from the burrito I had or maybe the meatloaf that was a week old. I though to myself hmmm what can I do i need FOOD in my belly. I got my winnie the poo sneakers on and my mr rogers glothes and my  underoos on. I love my velcro shoes i even criss cross them if i want to be naughty. So i got out the door. I found this place with bright lights THE Diner it was calling my name. I went in there and met a guy BOSDAR. What a man when i came in he was snorting and chopping ham up and kept yelling more and was laughing like a mad man. I said Sir can i please have a egg and some juice grape if you have it. He gave me the stink eye and said TRY THE HAMM BOY!!!!!!!. I did what the man said. The ham was thick and even could taste the juice squirting out. The egg was big and yellow. I paid my tab and walked in the cold air through dark alleys and people yelling from the bars. Im still scared ohhh what did i Just eat.

Wow what a great little find I have drove past this place many times and never stopped in. We'll there is a first time for everything.  My buddy and were leaving a local bar down the street and I was hungry as all hell and told him let's grab a bite to eat at this dive. We found some parking in the front which was not to hard to do at this late hour of the night. Walked into what looked like a old train car at one time or a trailer home. The place was brightly lit up and not very crowded which was a plus because there were not many seats in the place to start off with. So we flopped our ass at the counter and looked over what they had to eat. From looking at the grill I knew this was going to be another butter pit were everything was caked in butter for flavoring. I was wrong about that. My friend ordered a bowl of chili and a double burger and fries. I ordered some dish called the Slinger which consisted of the following toppings. A plate full of hash browns, Covered with Chili and onions with cheese, a hamburger pattie and two sunny side up egg's.  I was told if I could eat it all It would be free. Well I tried my best to eat it all there is just to much food there for one man to consume with a gut full of beer to go with it. The dish as awful as it sounds was pretty damn good with a little hot sauce it was even better. I don't think we will see Rachael Ray showing how too make this anytime soon it was real good. My buddy said he really enjoyed the chili and his couple burger.  I can tell you one thing I came away with from that night was a toilet bowl ring around me ass for the next 2 day's. I might have even lost a few pounds from eating this meal. I give them 4 stars for having a very friendly cook and making a great middle of the night meal for 2 under the influence idiots.

I only eat here after quite a long night of drinking but I have never been disappointed. People literally throw down for seats at the little counter. I have waited half an hour for such a coveted seat. It is quite amazing to watch a bunch of drunk people being diplomatic about who gets what seat. The two men behind the counter know whats up and can handle the entire counter all by themselves, my hat goes off to you. I always order a slinger because at that point in the night, I don't care about calories or grams of fat. What is a slinger? Two hamburger patties on top of hash browns, two slices of American cheese, two runny eggs, all covered in chili. You also get toast even though I have never been able to finish everything. My boyfriend loves the corned beef hash and everything is pretty reasonably priced. If you enjoy drinking in the city, this place should be on your list of grub spots.
Super cheap and tasty.  Classic greasy spoon.  Was cooked right in front of me fresh.  2 eggs over easy, with hash browns, 4 slices of bacon, toast and coffee was $8.

Went and got a slinger which was excellent, but the service was piss poor.  I asked the guy about the slinger challenge and he didn't even acknowledge that I had asked him a question.  All in all I probably won't return to this location unless I am completely desperate for food.

This 24 hour diner spot will take you back in time and probably to the bathroom later.  Totally worth it for both.  Only been there once during normal dinner hours (can't count the times between 1AM -4AM) and the service is still great.  Ask about items that aren't actually listed on the menu.  The "Super Slinger" isn't up there, but is definitely a drunk challenge and great for hangover removal.  Highly recommend if you want great breakfast/drunk/break up food.  Not much seating inside so don't plan to take a first date.

Me and my boyfriend are completely diner obsessed and this is the diner to top all diners.   The perfect traditional diner atmosphere: open 24 hours, only a counter to eat at, no menus except the one on the wall, food cooked in front of you, fast, delicious, just perfect!   My boyfriend swears they have the best burgers he's ever had in his life, but I have yet to try them, because they have the best pancakes I've ever had in my life. If you're not a diner fan or want to have someone waiting on you at a table, this won't be the place for you, but if you want affordable quick delicious food, you can't go wrong with the Diner Grill.

Go here when it's late. Go here when your drunk. Be respectful. It's an amazing little place that never closes. The operation is run by a one man spectacular, who handles all the of the orders right in front of your dazzled eyes. The food is cheap and delicious. When you're unsuccessful at finding someone to take home. Diner Grill will fill the void with a good time and good food. She said she had to go find her friends. I got breakfast, then I chased it with a burger. And I didn't have to wrap anything up. I might be in love with this place.

Diners are my thing. I had heard about this place because of a particular item: the Slinger. This is a plate of hash browns with two cheeseburger patties, two fried eggs, all smothered with chili. Bread and butter is also included. The Slinger will set you back $10 but everything else is pretty reasonably priced. Any other meal probably won't cost you more than $10. Menu is fairly extensive too. Service is super fast. The inside is pretty small. You eat at the counter which seats about 15 people. They cook everything right in front of you. If you really wanted to, you could probably reach out and touch the kitchen. Two cooks are usually working and they're pretty friendly with everyone. It makes for a nice little atmosphere because everyone can chat with one another. I'd definitely come back in the future.

I've been to Diner Grill only once to eat a late night burger because I had just moved into my new apartment nearby.  I thought the food was typical for a diner, nothing out of the ordinary. When I later found out that this was a place where money young people frequent after the bars closed, I decided to check it out after a long night of drinking.  The place was packed, so I decided not to wait and went to Taco Bell instead.  However, my brother and his friend ended up staying and they both got the Slinger.  The next day all I heard them say is that their stomachs were about to explode!!!!!!

I'm sure this is a place that, if you grew up with it, would carry great sentimental value.  For out of towners like me I will clarify:  Diner Grill is an old style lunch counter with a slew of hamburger shack classics.  However as a visitor, I have to say meh because the fries were over salty and the rib eye sandwich had no excuse to be on bread.  My husband was wrestling the thing attempting to eat it on the bun.  It might as well have been on a stick! The enjoyment of joining other revelers @ 5 am is not lost on me though.  So for an after bar nosh it's got 3 stars.
I like this place.  its right across the street from my house so its convenient (especially when all i want is a sprite at 3am)  the cooks are nice too!

I have to give the late-night chef credit where credit is due. He's a very real type of guy. Walking in, he was watching the cubs game and the grill rearing and ready to go. There are clearly regulars at his place. So head up.  The food was fine, it was nothing to write home about. It was standard diner fare and just fine by me.  What really piqued my interest was my bill. You see the old-school board with the prices, but my bill was significantly higher than I anticipated. I'm pretty good at mental math and it just did not make any sense.  That being said be sure to look for the large air duct that makes the back end of the place sound like you sitting next to a loud furnace, the speed of food preparation, and the creepy neighbors that stare out the window relentlessly at passers-by. Enjoy!

Ah, the Diner Grill--or Dinner Grill, depending on which side of the building you read. My senior year in high school, my English teacher recommended this place to my friends and me.  When you're in high school and an English teacher with full tattoo sleeves who plays in a hardcore punk band under the name G. Haad gives you a restaurant recommendation, you go. Of course, we went for the slinger, but we kept coming back for more and eventually realized everything on the menu is damn good.  Try the pancakes, especially after someone else has just ordered bacon.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Some people have complained about the service, but Kenny and Fernando are great guys.  If you're bothered by crudeness, this is not the place for you. Don't go during the day.  It just feels...wrong.
Best food ever when your drunk but I wouldnt go there sober Fernando is the man I remember a night me and some friends were trashed and we came to

Man... oh man....  When I lived in wrigleyville.. this was my go to spot! 3 am.. hungry.. boom.. 3 minute drive and that was settled... I've only been to this place between 3-6 am.. so I don't know about no line.. or any of that... but you do occasionally have a group of drunk assssssssssss people coming in screaming and stumbling.. but hey what do you expect at that time in that area...  dude there always took care of me.. ignoring the missing teeth and grimy looking apron/chef jacket.. dudes legit.. a REAL diner feel.. I went back after like 3 years of absence and he still remembered me!  I'm not too big of a traditional breakfast type of guy.. pancakes, toast, bacon, eggs is not my thing... BUT wtf.. a slinger?! man that is the sloppiest.. craziest thing that I have eaten at 4 am...  hash browns... a couple patties.. well when I useto go 8 or so years ago.. i would get 3 patties.. but the last time I went I got 2 so I don't know.. maybe he just ran out or something.. but anyways... 2 eggs sunny side up.. AND CHILI! poured on top.. wow.. greatness... i remember taking my first 'female' here and she was just disgusted at what I was throwing down.. lol said I'm going to die before I hit 40..  sometimes I consider moving back down in the area just so I can have a place to eat super late/early.. because man the burbs just blow...

Old-school diner in a converted train car.  Gritty short-order cooks straight from central casting.  Old greasy TV in the corner showing daytime game and talk shows.  An institution that's been there since my grandparents were kids in Chicago.  Old-timey, but not nostalgic or self-conscious.  Exactly what it purports to be, nothing more, nothing less.  The genuine article. When you want a quick diner meal, it's fast, cheap, and good.  Too bad they pulled out the old mini-jukeboxes at every other seat... that was a nice blast from the past.

I laughed when I read some of the reviews about the food in this place. First off.... Realize you're about to embark on a culinary journey that takes place in a trailer!!!!!! If you're expecting edible roses and foie gras then you've come to the wrong spot. Yes.... They pick up your raw beef patty, wipe their hands on their stank apron then touch your pickles. I wouldn't have it any other way. News flash.... When the line is around the corner and there is 15 orders hanging the cook is not going to spend a minute washing up his grubbers. This is at ANY establishment. Just because you can see the kitchen doesn't make it worse then others.... Just means you have never worked in a real kitchen before. Decent food at a decent price being served around the clock. If you don't like the sanitation practices do me a favor and make the line shorter!!!!

This is diner food! Don't expect more or less.  Decent burgers, great breakfast, a show!  There is something about watching  someone cook up 15 orders at once that blows me away and keeps me coming back. Always open and a great stop after having some beers at the Ten Cat or The Longroom.   The guys cooking are always friendly and you never know if a dance party may ensue when the jukebox is on.  Good chili to that goes even better with fries.  I have yet to try the infamous Slinger, but I have seen it prepared and it looks like ambrosia.  Hyperbole, maybe. So don't go here and expect something mind-blowing.  This is simple food cooked correctly and served fast and fresh.
Just saw they upped the price of the slinger now to 9.75. Not a big jump but $10 for this is a little high....might have to resort to the Golden Nugget for my late night eats...
A Chicago institution.  Doesn't look like much from the outside, but a great place for eggs and hash browns anytime.
Sun-Times crime report and patty melt.
Great late night diner. Old fashion, old passenger train car turned diner is s great place to get breakfast after a night out. Get the Slinger!
Be sure to talk to the mayor of Irving Park for some locks on sports betting
Hungover? Make your way to the Diner Grill. It's cheap and pretty tasty. I've never had a bad meal here, and I will always look forward to going back for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

This place is wonderful. I give it five stars not just because of the food, but because of the experience. There's something about sitting in one of those stools, facing the open grill, that's so nostalgic and a throwback to simpler times....the food though is very good. Greasy and cheap, perfect for hangovers or artery-clogging cravings. This place is simple with no frills whatsoever. If you're pretentious or have high expectations, do everyone a favor and avoid. If you're looking for a good and filling meal, bingo.

I once saw a guy eat 3 slingers in one sitting (he turned purple).  It was an amazing feat that Adam on Man vs. Food couldn't tackle. I started eating here in 2005 late night almost exclusively. The staff is matter of fact, a lil grouchy (you would be too if you were dealing with drunks all night), but the food is nothing but Greasy Goodness. I recommend the ham and cheese omelette and the bacon cheeseburgers.  I was a little scared to eat here for lunch, fearing that I would ruin my opinion of the place, but it's just as good during the day.   I think the bathrooms are original - try not to use them. The diner now accepts credit cards.

No. This place is the worst.  Granted, I arrived here at 5 a.m. on New Year's Day.  But the place is dirty and the food is gross. You can see the ingredients as they cook.  A loaf of white bread sits there as if to say, "You're about to eat me, and you will regret it."  I had the French toast.  Bland as hell. The cooks are inattentive.  You may sit at the counter for 15 minutes before you finally flag one down.  I put my money on the counter after eating and it sat there for another 15 minutes.  Do you want my money or not, guys? Some people will defend a rat hole like this by saying it has color or local flavor.  Yeah, I suppose nightly food abortions can be fun if you hate your stomach lining and love watching salmonella in the making. Great place to go if you're a fan of a rancid toilet filled to the brim with an unflushable wad of toilet paper. Avoid Diner Grill at all costs.

You want a timeless greasy spoon diner experience? This is it. Don't expect anything more or less. They've probably been serving the same menu for the past 50 years and that's what's to love about it. That and you never know what kind of random combination of people are going to be eating here, but you know they probably wouldn't be seen together in any other setting than this. So basically, Diner Grill brings people together, over greasy burgers and fries. Which is kind of like America, with people from all sorts of ethnic backgrounds, social statuses, and cultural niches living side by side and getting fat together.  P.S. They take credit card now, which they didn't before. The first technological advance the Grill has seen since the advent of the cordless phone.

I went to this place and had the slinger. It was nothing I couldn't cook at home and this place is lame. If it wasn't  in Chicago near bars and open late they would have the usual two or three customers that many similar suburban diners have at three in the morning. Your better off going to White Castle

Now this is my type of diner.  It's just one long counter and that's it.  No table or booth seating, just the counter, which seats roughly 10-12 people.  Because of that, you get the benefit of watching your delicious breakfast being cooked before your very eyes by the cooks, who also act as the waiters as well.  It's a beautiful thing. The food is really good too.  It's your typical diner fair, but they're not afraid to throw in some pork chops or a steak with your eggs if you so desire (which I typically do).  It's a "greasy spoon" type of place, and that is a beautiful thing.  I'd take this place anyday over any of the Pancake House chains, or the Lincoln, or the Alps up the street on Irving.  These guys make the best, greasy, filling breakfast.  It hits the spot everytime. So I guess the name of the place says it all: Diner Grill.  Two words you really can't go wrong with, especially at this place.  No frills joint, a counter, couple of cooks, and great breakfast.

THIS REVIEW IS BASED ON EATING AFTER 4 AM. After a late night of drinking, we ate here. I thought to myself, "Damn, this is good food." Of course, crackers at 4 am would taste great to me. I would never eat here for any other reason than to grab food after drinking.

I'm not sure what the hype is about this place. I came here to try out their legendary "Slinger" (described numerous times throughout these reviews) and found that it tasted like a pile of food that's bad for you. The ingredient combination wasn't as intriguing as I had hoped, and none of the individual components were particularly compelling. As diners go, this one ranks as average, and there are way too many other "average" diners around here to bother with this one.

i love this place. now that I don't live 2 minute away in post drunken crawl, i'd consider re-locating back to within a block or 2. all dudes are friendly and helpful. food is awesome, tho may give u some DI issues, especially if u go nuts with hot sause the slinger (by fat the best thing for waffle houses' hashbrown topped all the way withdrawl) .  place is a bit cramped but the crazy line at 3am won't last long - those drunks will eventually need to find a place to pass out or puke.  note, it ain't a fine dining institution. not a place u wanna go for organic fruit crepes on freshly squeezed juice while trying to impress a eco-conscious trust fund baby ya just met saturday nite for a brunch.   however, it's TEH place to go and get some greasy breakfast food after a having few too many shots (and it's too late to regret).   btw, direction for the washroom. run outside and find your way to a dark spot along the alley...

I think I just got my hopes up. Went for the famous slinger (hash browns, two bunless cheese burgers, grilled onions, and two eggs over easy all smothered in chilli, with white toast; $8.50). The flavor just wasn't all that. Much better gluttonous breakfasts in Chicago include Ohio House Coffee Shop's "Dueces," and many things from Valois.

I was sober.  I gotta start by saying that.  it was breakfast on a weekday and I was stone cold sober.  I ordered the Slinger (2 cheeseburger patties, hash browns, chili and 2 eggs over-easy) and it was awesome!  Tasty, fast, and CHEAP.  A great TRUE diner, and I mean diner, not coffee shop.  One long counter with bar stools.

lives right next door for like 3 years! i used to go in eyes half shut round 3 am after a good round of drinks! they have anything from eggs and pancakes to the all mighty slinger which I have yet to try because i cant afford that much toilet paper, but no matter what u get its delicious quick and straight to the point! Staff is happy and fast, grill right in front of you no surprise sauce! just be aware of the heavy lights if you just came from a dark bar or for some reason have them heavy :)

I've lived down the street from this gem for 7 months. I'm not sure what took me 7 months to get here, but I'm so glad I eventually got there. What you see is what you get at the Diner/Dinner (depending on whether you're standing on Irving or Marshfield) Grill. It's a counter, a dude, a fryer and a griddle. And it's AWESOME. Greasy, comforty (go with it), cheap awesomeness. It's open 24 hours and again, it's awesome.  The menu is simple with a handful of breakfast and lunch/dinner options that make your arteries harden by just reading it. I think I just gained 5 lbs by writing this...

After a relaxing night at one of the local bars I stopped by for a late night bite with my date.  The place was small... semi crowded... a little loud... and frickin' sweet!  Tons of unique charm to the place, the ceiling is low, counter is slanted, the crowd is definitely a pretty eclectic mix late at night.  Food wise, it was cheap, quick, made right in front of you by a man who is well versed in the art of the griddle. Oh, and it was good! I will be returning here without a doubt.
the greaseburgers here are so good  you would invite Sarah palin  just so you can see her eat like a pig

WEAKKKKK. Was excited to get a good late night greasy diner meal for cheap, but that wasn't the case. My friend and I ordered a grill cheese and bacon sandwich, he got a side of fries and I got hash browns. The meal ended up coming out to like fifteen bucks before tip and COULD NOT BELIEVE IT. Yeah this place is categorized by only one $ on Yelp but that doesn't really serve to much justice in my opinion because yeah its in the lowest price bracket but this place is WAY OVERPRICED. A bacon cheeseburger is more than a dollar and a half cheaper than the sandwiches we got, and a DOUBLE bacon cheeseburger is about 10 cents more than a bacon grilled cheese. The sandwich wasn't bad because its pretty hard to screw up a grilled cheese but it wasn't even like how I make them at home not doing anything special to it. Not to mention the pile of fries and and hash browns we got with our meal wasn't even half a handful (costed $2.25).  I  think this is the most overrated yelp experience I have had so far, no doubt. I don't know if everyone that gives this place good reviews doesn't realize the quality maybe because there way too wasted or what but It disappoints me that I won't come back to this place even though it's right down the street from my place.

I have been coming to the Grill for years now and it is the only place I go late night when I am drunk.  I have been in the loop and taken a taxi just to have the delicious "Slinger"...I actually have an album of all the certificates I got from finishing...and to this date, I have finished every single one..they are that good! Be prepared to wait, listen to loud people (prolly me), and dominate large amounts of grub

Went here based on the Yelp reviews, and thought the food was great. Seems to have a 15 person seating capacity, and only at the counter, which is the only reason to give it four stars...hard to bring all of your friends. Who am I kidding, I have no friends, as long as my girlfriend and I can sit down, who cares. Regardless, feels like a diner you see in movies where really tense things happen between characters. That probably doesn't help much.

The name really says it all.. Hasn't been updated probably ever! From the outside not very inviting .. This joint is Old School!! Just good coffee and classic Diner food consisting of mainly breakfast items.. I have 3 reco's here that Never Fail... Pancakes, Slinger and Dbl Cheeseburger! Almost always get the Dbl with fries it just has great flavor...ALWAYS OPEN 24/7

Simple tiny place.  Real basic food.  However, the charm is overwhelming for a white-painted converted trailer and the food is hood and honest.  I loved my bacon double and fries.  I'll go back the first chance I get.

This place has saved my life. If ever I die and end up someplace else, I want a live in a neighborhood with a diner like this. 24 hours a day, breakfast artery clogging goodness in a charming small diner with friendly staff and affordable prices. Hell YES!!!

Diners like this are awesome. I and my three out of town guests had a blast here, because shoving a bunch of drunk people in a cramped bright space whilst eating junk food served by gruff big city old timers late at night is automatically F U N. But their portions are lame. You should get twice as much burger and fry for your money. I would be a gol dang regular here if they weren't so chintzy, but I think they'll do fine without me.

I'm hanging out with Team Pigout last night, and it's time for some after hours eats.  One of our members just got off work and it's another member's birthday, so we couldn't settle for just nearby Maxwell St.  No, what I wanted was something legendary I heard about separately from two different friends - the slinger. For my Illini peepz, I consider it the city's version of Merry Ann's stack: hash browns, onions, cheeseburger, eggs, toast...and the whole thing is drowned in chili.  Not the same as sausage gravy, but quite delicious nonetheless.  Happily earned my certificate of completion last night. Also, because it was my friend's birthday, they made her a special birthday treat: a giant pancake penis, with a scoop of ice cream at the tip.  Might've been inappropriate to some...but those losers don't come to Diner Grill at 3am.  Us and the whole diner were laughing our asses off - I think we had more fun here than we would have if we tried to find another bar at that hour!  Good stuff, DG!

I often think I was born in the wrong era. I should have been mixing it up in the 50's and 60's as rock n roll was taking shape. I should have been at the diner with Mickey Rourke and helping Steve Guttenberg write his NFL test for his girlfriend. That should have been me! If you've felt the same way you'll be glad to know that there's a place on Irving and Ashland called the Diner Grill. It's that old style diner you've always dreamed of, you know like the one in the Nighthawks painting. Except take away the fedoras and cool conversation and replace it with a drunken young crowd giggling uncontrollably.  It's hard to have a bad time at the diner, it's mostly delicious but everything is total theater. You have the wonderful mix of patrons, who at times might threaten to stab you, to Kenny the wonderful hash slinger who might just stab you himself if you act out of line. It's that kind of excitement that keeps me coming back for more. It's always a fun time and everyone is on it.

Went here after a night of drinking at The Long Room across the street.  It's fine.  I don't think I would ever go here if it wasn't late at night and I needed some food to go with all the alcohol I'd already ingested.  Maybe I just didn't have a memorable enough experience to push this to a 4 for sentimental reasons.  Because I doubt anyone rates it a) soberly or b) objectively.

The Diner Grill is a great piece of Americana in our modern city. From the 50's vintage looking trailer building to the hot plate worn counter tops, the Diner Grill brings you back 60 years to a much easier time in Chicago. The cooks grill all the delicious greasy food right in front of you on their flattop griddles along with their explosive personalities and joking demeanor.  Eggs, hashbrowns, grilled cheese, bacon, pancakes ,burgers and their famous garbage place, The Slinger, the Diner Grill serves for all sorts of appetites.  They are open late, 3am on the weekends, and I always have a great time and most importantly they serve up delicious diner food in a great atmosphere.

umm...overrated. I hate to say it but i really didn't like it at all.  We came here after a night of drinking expecting to be wowed - and we were all very un-wowed.  Sure, it was busy - no complaints there as we were expecting it.  But the staff was sorta rude and the food was mediocre and lacked much flavor for any of the four of us that went.  Maybe we weren't drunk enough? I'd rather go somewhere else.

The Diner Grill = the best way to avoid further late-night drinking and offset some of the damage already done. It's 3am on a Sat night (or Sunday morning), and we have worst intentions of continuing to imbibe at the Green Mill. But someone's hungry... REALLY hungry. And as the driver, he holds the reigns to our after-hours fate. He's wondering where he can get a burger. Not a burrito, oh no... boy wants his burger. Me: McDonald's! D: NO! Me: I think there's some Mexican joint that also serves burgers 'round the corner from Green Mill! D: No, you're just making that up! Me: Ok. Probably. We end up finding the Diner Grill and all 14 counter stools are filled with what appears to be standard-issue raucous frat boys. There's a wait, and some of these intoxicated customers are hanging out outside the door. Pass! We make a detour to the ledge along the window behind the counter stools and improvise by jumping up (well, one of us couldn't make it up but she's a petite thing) and ordering burgers and corned beef hash. We devour our burgers there, without a counter, without chairs.  Totally a smart move. 'Cause we don't wait! Me: Hmmm. This burger smells funny! D: Um, it's called grease. It was indeed a pretty greasy burger... but really rather good. And it thwarted further tomfoolery uptown at the Mill. $2 burgers that save you from yourself? Priceless.

I just tried this place for the first time and let's just say I have been there twice within a 12 hour period. Who wouldn't love a tiny diner where everything is made right in front of your face. By recommendation I got the double cheese burger the first time I went. It was delicious!!! The second time I went I got a bacon, egg & cheese sandwich with hash browns and again, it was delicious! The cooks are extremely nice and will do anything to make your experience a good one. I will be back again and again and again!!!!!!

I live a bunch of blocks down on Paulina but at night if you look down my street I see a bright ball of light and I know it's Diner Grill shinning bright telling me if you are drunk and want some drunk foods come forth! Perfect drunk food, not sure how it is without the beer goggles. I had a double with bacon and it hit the spot!

Ok, so I wouldn't consider myself a snob, but I would consider myself a germaphobe.  And the fact that they were walking around, handling money and such, and then not using gloves when handling the food freaked me out.  I mean, I guess other restaurants probably do that too, it's just that they don't make the food right in front of you, so you don't know about it.  Still - I would rather just not know about it than see it being done right in front of me.  Also - not a very veg friendly place.

The Diner Grill is a super place for cheap post-bar eats.  Order the Slinger-a super sexy, steaming pile of hash browns, eggs, cheese, hamburger patties and chili (forgive me if I've missed any ingredients)  When I finished eating all of mine, the cook presented me with a certificate of achievement, and proceeded to make me a penis-shaped pancake with ice cream for dessert.   The bad thing about this place is that oftentimes your fellow diners are so drunk it's hard to avoid talking to someone in booze-speak.  Even if you aren't trashed the environment will make you think you are (or wish you were)   Bring cash.

what a great way to end a night of devilish debauchery!  yes it gets crowded but since its open 24hrs a day, have no fear you will get your chance to eat.  the menu is filled with simple classics, made fresh to order on the flat top grill right before your salivating self. im partial to the double cheeseburger (its like mcdonalds but without the corporate bullshit). others cant live without the slinger,, or as a friend calls it "the chicken burrito". and sometimes i cant resist the gooey grilled cheese with bacon. but whatever you do order the milkshake -- its a classic, with real icecream and milk blended into a tasty treat.

this is your typical sit-at-the-counter diner. nothing groundbreaking, but they do get bonus points for people watching, being across the street from my favorite bar and open 24 hours a day, never burning my toast and always making my bacon crispy. diner grill, you're alright by me.

This is the place to go if its late and your drunk and hungry, I had a denver omlette and my friend had the cheeseburger, All in All pretty good but nothing special. They could make a tv sit-com of this place, Last time I went 2 cops on my left and a crazy homeless guy on my right, and another guy singing along to the jukebox, very entertaining.

Impromptu Chicago Institution Visit Mission: Diner Grill! I may have gone here last night (morning?) at 2am.  Yes, I realize it was/is a Tuesday.  No, I wasn't  blitzed out of my mind. Not even a little bit, actually.  But, they ARE open, so it IS fair game.  The cooks wear white hats, and watch the Sox game highlights. They never close? Never.  Possibly I ordered a "Garbage Omelette." --consists of basically all of their toppings at DG + eggs.  I ate all of it.  Potentially I could've considered a "slinger." I will come back on a week I haven't eaten, it's only $8.50!? (PS. The "slinger" has its own Wiki entry, it's legit).  en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sl… Diner Grill is cheaper than McDonald's.  AND.  Best diner Diet Coke I've EVER had.  (I'm a purist, straight up) My diner expedition=success, even SOBER.  So, next time...a little more booze, perhaps a slinger. Let's do this.

The best place I've been for a late night bite after a few drinks. Ingredients are just OK, but that's not why you come here. The vibe is classic short order diner. Ken's a quality cook. He delivers the basics exactly how you ask him too. He's always there. And willing to have a friendly chat with anyone.

My husband loves a good flat-top grill diner and has been wanting come here for ages. After a few drinks at the Long Room, I finally agreed to stop in for some late night grub. we each had a burger, he some fries and me some hash browns with cheese. Everything was tasty and cheap, but it wasn't the drunken food orgy I was hoping for. I'd say it's good in a pinch and probably equally as tasty as many other options, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Oh, The Diner. This place will always hold a special place in my heart, as it is about as classic an example of a Chicago diner as you can get. I have witnessed a brawl, people taking wedding pictures, and pretty much everything else minus people having sex at this diner. Also, it was about a 3 minute walk from my apartment and it's open 24 hours.  I always get the denver omelet, hash browns, and toast when I go here, which is AMAZING. But they also have burgers, chicken sandwiches, etc. Pretty much the regular fare for a diner. Only problem is, it is a bit overpriced. But for some reason...I don't care, and I keep coming back. Go figure? Maybe it's the classic white counter, too-bright lighting, red cushiony diner stools attached to the ground, and cooks in white uniforms. Gotta love The Diner.

70+ reviews for this place?  Chicagoans must be pretty hard up to visit a diner, because I'm not sure what the fuss is all about.   The burgers are alright, if a little undersized.  Get the triple if you're hungry, the double if you had a late lunch, and the single if you're on a diet.  The bacon is a fine addition to it, nice and crispy.  The fries are pretty average.   I went to Diner Grill several times before even trying what it's known for, the Slinger.  The Slinger, made for the late evening meal, is an enormous plate of hash browns, grilled onions, two cheeseburger patties, and two eggs over easy, all completely enshrouded with a few ladles of chili.  I, unlike most other patrons, attacked the Slinger while completely sober.  It's not even that bad, but they need to use a better chili.  You are getting chili in nearly every bite of the Slinger, so this is crucial.   Service has been fine each time I've been.  There's only been one guy working, but he doesn't even break a sweat cooking ten different meals on the grill at once.   I don't think the food at Diner Grill is good enough to warrant the ratings it's picked up here, but it's worth at least one trip just for the experience, whether you're gearing up for a night of hard drinking, in the middle of one, or coming off one the night before.

Still amazing. How is it that Ken is working every time I make it in here?  That man must never sleep. I was there around 9 on a Saturday, and it was completely empty.  A great quick meal before my night of heavy drinking.

I went to check this place out aftyer reading a review that suggested you go inj the off hours.  It's a real neighborhood joint.  There was me a cop and a few guys that looked like they spend the whole day there.  A TV was playing the daytime court shows, there were newspapers scattered on the coumter for anyone to read.  The cook mentioned to the cop, yeah "it's quiet now but we got the Cubs tonight".  I got a nice portion of eggs and home fries for 3 bucks, coffee w/ refill for $1.50 and toast.  While there a guy calls up and asks the cook is it the kind of place you could take a date, the guy said "It's a grill, you can get a burger for a dollar ninety".  The guy asks him, "can you reccomend a place to take a date?"  The cook said, "buddy I haven't been on a date in 40 years".  I know this because after hanging up the phone he told the story for all to hear.  For less than 5 bucks I had a great late afternoon breakfast, a show and a friendly atmosphere.

This place is just awesome to go to after a night of some medium drinking.  I have only went after a night out and it hits the spot.  Perfect for a helping of grease and oil.  They have a lot of options and you can pretty much order whatever you want.  I have never tried the Slinger, maybe one day I will when I am ready.  It's definitely a classic and hope it never disappears.
